title: Chris Lozos
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809045203/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Designers](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809045203/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Designers) : Chris Lozos**

Chris Lozos began life as a lover of [letters](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809045203/http:/typophile.com/wiki/letter). As a teenager, he earned pocket money lettering mail boxes and trucks. He studied Design at [Carnegie Mellon University](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809045203/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Carnegie%20Mellon%20University) (called Carnegie Institute of Technology at the time) where he earned a BFA in [Graphic Design](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809045203/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Graphic%20Design). While at CMU, he studied with [calligrapher](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809045203/http:/typophile.com/wiki/calligraphy) [Arnold Bank](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809045203/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Arnold%20Bank) who brought out a love of historic letterforms, learned to set [hot metal](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809045203/http:/typophile.com/wiki/hot%20metal) type in the Laboratory Press established there by [Jack Stauffacher](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809045203/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Jack%20Stauffacher). Chris also was influenced by guest professors [Hermann Zapf](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809045203/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Hermann%20Zapf), Rudy DeHarek, Martin Krampen and Gui Bonnsieppe (of the HfG Ulm). His greatest influence was typography proffessor Ken Hiebert, a student of [Emil Ruder](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809045203/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Emil%20Ruder).  
After several decades of practicing graphic design, Chris renewed his affair with letter forms and began to design typefaces. In the past 2 years, he has designed type families, Leporello, Align, [Now Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809045203/http:/dezcom.com/typefaces/nowsans/), [Weimar Plakat 1923 Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809045203/http:/dezcom.com/typefaces/weimarplakat/), [Dez Squeeze](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809045203/http:/dezcom.com/typefaces/squeeze/), Chrishand, [Froggy](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809045203/http:/dezcom.com/typefaces/froggy/), [Boulder](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809045203/http:/dezcom.com/typefaces/boulder/), Backhand, Forehand, Dez HeadsUp, Dez SuperEgo [Dez Tovarich](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809045203/http:/dezcom.com/typefaces/tovarich/), and Petroula and hopes to be releasing them soon for distribution.  
Chris abhors puns.
